results.title: Town meeting of the world
results.brief_description: this film is based on a recording of Mr Attlee’s opening speech at the first session of the UNO General Assembly in London in 1946. Designed to instil in its audience an active interest in the work of the United Nations Organization, the film shows some of the horrors of war, and some of the fruits of peace.

results.title: Towards Baruya manhood. Part 2. Village life II
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, John Martin-Jones and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: Village life of the Baruya tribe in the Eastern Highlands of New Guinea. Includes work on a new garden, making a scarecrow, a cassowary hunters’ dance, part of a healing ceremony, and women feeding their pigs.

results.title: Towards 2000: Robots and Energy
results.brief_description: The Robots are Coming- More and more jobs are being taken over each year by the robots of the world. Most of the jobs are tedious, but the robots don’t seem to mind. “Energy”- The sun and the wind could supply us with most of our energy needs - pollution free. “Research Into Space”- The Americans and the Russians are showing the world that space has no boundaries but getting up there does present problems from time to time. “Other Changes”- Electronic bagpipes and a hotel room the size of a phone box - they are just two of the changes taking place right now.

results.title: Toward intimacy (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicole Hubert and Debbie McGee
results.brief_description: A woman with a disability retains both her sexuality and her right to seek, develop and sustain a relationship with the partner of her choice. In this documentary, four disabled women from across Canada share their personal experiences and raise important issues including sexuality, self-esteem, stereotyping and parenting. It is their opportunity to say, “this is the way it is and not the way you think it is”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Nicole Hubert and Debbie McGee
